body.p: The Change Managment Process covers all changes to IT systems (hardware and software assets) and policy documentation. The following items fall within the scope of this Change Management Processs.

row.entry: Installation, patching, upgrade or removal of software products including operating systems, commercial off-the-shelf packages, internally developed packages, utilities, and desktop base images
Installation, modification, removal or relocation of computing equipment such as servers, storage, network printers, and network equipment. Rebooting of production servers.
Moves, adds, changes and deletes such as firewall changes, access methods, shared system file permission changes, secure FTP keys, etc.

Changes to databases or files such as additions, reorganizations, and major maintenance Facilities In Installation, modification, removal or relocation of equipment in wiring closets, telecommunications rooms, data centers including power conditioning, cooling, fire suppression, and environmental monitoring/alarming systems
Application changes being promoted to production, new application systems being introduced, and obsolete application systems being removed

Requests for creation, deletion, or revision to batch job schedules, back-up schedules, maintenance windows or other production schedules managed by IT Services In Services being moved into production, service changes with significant user impact, and services being retired
Any changes to standards, procedures, and guidelines Non-production Out Changes to non-production configuration items (CIs) or resources
Installation, modification, de-installation, or relocation of PBX equipment and services

section.title: Out of Scope
section.p: There are tasks performed either by the Information Security Management (ISM) Team or by end users, which do not fall under the policies and procedures of Change Management. The following items are not in scope of this Change Management Processs.

row.entry: Applications that are in the process of being implemented are controlled by the change control process established for the particular project that is underway. (If out of scope, application teams have the responsibility to communicate changes to any affected customers.)
Decision to commit resources and provide a new service to customers, up to the time a service goes into production.
Any modification or relocation of individual desktop.
Assigning desktop equipment to a new individual or system.
Any modification or relocation of individual phone lines and desk phones (maintained in Pinnacle)

Examples include:
End User password resets
User adds/deletes/modifications
Adding, deleting or revising end-user security groups and roles
